flow.descriptionCdata:
94834085-3d4b-4d9a-b699-761e22eba6bd.3efadd3b-3acf-4872-82c8-b93b896f0e04.description=
This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

Inputs\:
    seconds - The number of seconds to wait.

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the "completed sleep" message if the operation completed successfully and an error message otherwise. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
94834085-3d4b-4d9a-b699-761e22eba6bd.418ebcb7-8add-4126-a1c6-236f2b6f4af9.description=
This operation iterates through a list of values. It is not recommended to modify the value of the "list" and "separator" inputs during the iteration process.

Inputs\:
    list - The list to iterate through.
    separator - A delimiter separating the list elements.
Default value\: ‘,’ (comma) 

Results\:
    resultString - The current list element (if the response is "has more").

Responses\:
    has more - Another value was found in the list and it has been returned.
    no more - The iterator has gone through the entire list. This response is returned once per list iteration.  A subsequent call to the List iterator operation restarts the list iteration process.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Note\:
   The position of the iterator in the list is tracked by each step's unique identifier. Therefore, you can simultaneously iterate through the same list from multiple steps.
94834085-3d4b-4d9a-b699-761e22eba6bd.5ceaa6f4-57c7-4919-b151-cfe472ad0691.description=
This operation does not do anything. It can be used to filter flow variables by defining them as inputs and filtering them in the Results tab.

Inputs\:
    field1 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field2 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field3 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.
    field4 – An optional input that can be used for filtering flow variables.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the value of  "field1" as it was specified at input or when filtered. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
94834085-3d4b-4d9a-b699-761e22eba6bd.6448a302-ffae-4846-b72e-e1c815fe8124.description=
This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

Inputs\:
    seconds - The number of seconds to wait.

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the "completed sleep" message if the operation completed successfully and an error message otherwise. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
94834085-3d4b-4d9a-b699-761e22eba6bd.6bea1ff0-3c6d-4ea7-82f1-0b1d243bc9b2.description=Removes a server from SA being given the name or ID of the server. Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. serverName - The name of the server. serverID - The id of the server reference. If this input is provided, then 'serverName' is ignored. Responses\: success - The operation has completed successfully. failure - The operation has failed. 94834085-3d4b-4d9a-b699-761e22eba6bd.8b58bfdc-972a-4a64-b48e-b588379f1bbe.prompt=VMWare Host\: 94834085-3d4b-4d9a-b699-761e22eba6bd.9c31904c-a0cf-4bc9-88c1-01c46d08655d.description=
This operation iterates through a list of values. It is not recommended to modify the value of the "list" and "separator" inputs during the iteration process.

Inputs\:
    list - The list to iterate through.
    separator - A delimiter separating the list elements.
Default value\: ‘,’ (comma) 

Results\:
    resultString - The current list element (if the response is "has more").

Responses\:
    has more - Another value was found in the list and it has been returned.
    no more - The iterator has gone through the entire list. This response is returned once per list iteration.  A subsequent call to the List iterator operation restarts the list iteration process.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Note\:
   The position of the iterator in the list is tracked by each step's unique identifier. Therefore, you can simultaneously iterate through the same list from multiple steps.
94834085-3d4b-4d9a-b699-761e22eba6bd.a9bcb3eb-a65e-4102-a099-a503b1ba3f8f.description=
Sets the power state of virtual machine (poweredOn,poweredOff,suspended). Does nothing if the virtual machine is already in the desired power state.

Inputs\:
    host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
    user - VMWare username.
    password - VMWare user's password.
    port - Port to connect on.
    protocol - Connection protocol.
Valid values\: "https", "http"    
    closeSession - Close the internally kept VMware Infrastructure API session at completion of operation.
Valid values\: "true", "false"
    async - Asynchronously perform the task.
Valid values\: "true", "false"
    taskTimeOut - Time to wait before the operation is considered to have failed (seconds).
    virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
    vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type.
Valid values\: "inventorypath", "name", "ip", "hostname", "uuid", "vmid"    
    vmPowerState - Virtual machine power state to set (poweredOn, poweredOff, suspended).

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed successfully.
    failure - Something went wrong.
    no action - The operation completed with no action performed.

Returns\:
    returnResult - Task ID or task completion return message.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
94834085-3d4b-4d9a-b699-761e22eba6bd.a9e23863-dfcd-49bc-890d-b7156888799c.prompt=VMWare Host\: 94834085-3d4b-4d9a-b699-761e22eba6bd.bb95f1a6-5462-4f2d-941c-89f5d98a888e.description=
Revert a virtual machine to an existing named snapshot or the most current one if none specified.

Inputs\:
    host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
    user - VMWare username.
    password - VMWare user's password.
    port - Port to connect on.
    protocol - Connection protocol.
Valid values\: "https", "http"
    closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation.
Valid values\: "true", "false"
    async - Asynchronously perform the task.
Valid values\: "true", "false"
    taskTimeOut - Time to wait before the operation is considered to have failed (seconds).
Default value\: 800
    virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
    vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type (inventorypath, name, ip, hostname, uuid, vmid).
    snapshotName - Name of snapshot. If the snapshot name is not provided the operation performs a revert to the current snapshot (one level up in the hierachy from the 'You are here' position).

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed successfully.
    failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
    returnResult - Task ID or task completion return message.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
flow.name: resetDakotaVMEnvironment
